intro: Rosa chavinii subvar. laggeri, commonly known as the Chavín rose, is a rare and ornamental shrub native to the Andean regions of Peru. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and clusters of small, fragrant pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring well-drained, acidic soils. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated leaflets that contribute to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical conservation efforts.
